# Council of Ministers
## Decree No. 71 of 2025
### Appointing a member from the industrial sector to the Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Industry

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 H, corresponding to May 10, 2024 AD,
- And Law No. 56 of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 concerning ministerial substitutions and delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the proposal of the Minister of Commerce and Industry,
- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers,

We have decreed the following

### Article One
Faisal Abdulaziz Faisal Al-Zain <orig>فيصل عبد العزيز فيصل الزين</orig> is appointed as a member of the Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>, representing the industrial sector, for a renewable term of three years.

### Article Two
The Minister of Commerce and Industry shall implement this decree, and it shall come into force from the date of its issuance and be published in the Official Gazette.

Amir of Kuwait
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Acting Prime Minister
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Minister of Commerce and Industry
Khalifa Abdullah Dhahi Al-Ajil Al-Askar <orig>خليفة عبد الله ضاحي العجيل العسكر</orig>

Issued at Seif Palace on: 24 Shawwal 1446 H
Corresponding to: April 22, 2025 AD

## Decree No. 72 of 2025
### Revoking the Kuwaiti nationality of certain individuals

- And with the approval of the Council of Ministers,

The Kuwaiti nationality shall be revoked from the individuals listed below and from anyone who may have acquired it with them by dependency:

# Council of Ministers Decision No. 411 of 2025 Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship Certificates from Certain Individuals

**The Council of Ministers**
- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhul-Qa'dah 1445 H, corresponding to 10 May 2024 G,
- And Article (21 bis "A") of Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 concerning the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding ministerial substitutions and delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Acting Minister of Interior,

**Has Decided**

### Article One
The Kuwaiti citizenship certificate shall be withdrawn from the individuals listed below, and Kuwaiti citizenship shall also be withdrawn from any person who may have acquired it by dependency from the holder of said certificate:
1. Rifai Khalaf Awad Salem Al-Shammari <orig>رفاعي خلف عواد سالم الشمري</orig>.
2. Kamal Khalaf Awad Salem Al-Shammari <orig>كمال خلف عواد سالم الشمري</orig>.
3. Rashid Khalaf Awad Salem Al-Shammari <orig>رشيد خلف عواد سالم الشمري</orig>.
4. Bardan Khalaf Awad Salem Al-Shammari <orig>بردان خلف عواد سالم الشمري</orig>.
5. Matloub Khalaf Awad Salem Al-Shammari <orig>مطلوب خلف عواد سالم الشمري</orig>.
6. Saeed Mohammed Hadi Dhiban Al-Ajmi <orig>سعيد محمد هادي ذيبان العجمي</orig>.
7. Masoud Mohammed Hadi Dhiban Al-Ajmi <orig>مسعود محمد هادي ذيبان العجمي</orig>.
8. Hadi Mohammed Hadi Dhiban Al-Ajmi <orig>هادي محمد هادي ذيبان العجمي</orig>.
9. Mohammed Awad Jamran Mohammed Al-Ajmi <orig>محمد عوض جمران محمد العجمي</orig>.
10. Muthker Manahi Ayedh Shatran Al-Ajmi <orig>مذكر مناحي عايض شتران العجمي</orig>.
11. Mubarak Manahi Ayedh Shatran Al-Ajmi <orig>مبارك مناحي عايض شتران العجمي</orig>.
12. Ahmed Gholoum Haji Hassan <orig>أحمد غلوم حاجي حسن</orig>.

### Article Two
The Minister of Interior shall implement this decision, and it shall come into force from the date of its issuance and be published in the Official Gazette.

Acting Prime Minister
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah

Issued on: 22 Shawwal 1446 H
Corresponding to: 20 April 2025 G

Submitted by: The Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>.
Against: Ghazal Insurance Company <orig>شركة غزال للتأمين</orig>.

Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>
In the name of His Highness the Amir of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>
Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>
Court Clerk <orig>أمين السر</orig>

## Decision
On Thursday, 10/4/2025, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>
With the membership of Mr. Zaid Abdulhadi Al-Matar <orig>زيد عبدالهادي المطار</orig>, Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>
And in the presence of Mr. Khaled Abdullah Al-Qaisi <orig>خالد عبدالله القيسي</orig>, Court Clerk <orig>أمين السر</orig>
In Application No. (23/2024 Bankruptcy Declaration)
Registered under automated No. 240825520
Submitted by: The Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>
Against: Ghazal Insurance Company <orig>شركة غزال للتأمين</orig>
After reviewing the documents and the letter from the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> dated 6/4/2025, requesting the issuance of a decision authorizing him to obtain the bank account statements of Ghazal Insurance Company <orig>شركة غزال للتأمين</orig> for the period from 1/1/2025 to date, and in accordance with the provisions of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> and its executive regulations:
The facts are established by the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> in the application issued on 16/3/2025, affirming the right of the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> to carry out his scope of work in conducting financial and criminal investigations, making necessary financial and in-kind settlements, obtaining arrest warrants, pursuing financial and legal actions, and filing lawsuits as indicated in his letter dated 16/2/2025, to which we refer to avoid repetition.
Whereas Article 1 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> stipulates that "Precautionary Measures <orig>التدابير التحفظية</orig>: Procedures taken by the Bankruptcy Court or the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> in accordance with the provisions of this Law with the aim of preserving and managing the debtor's assets or the bankruptcy estate's <orig>أموال التفليسة</orig> assets and preventing their concealment, including placing seals on the debtor's place of business, appointing a temporary trustee <orig>أمين مؤقت</orig> to manage his assets, placing restrictions on the debtor or any related party in disposing of his assets, or imposing a travel ban on him and any of his board members or managers, or the board members or managers of any company related to the debtor, for a specific period or until a certain event occurs." And Article (9) of the same law stipulates that "The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall have jurisdiction over the following: 1- . 2- . 3- . 4- Issuing all decisions that fall within the jurisdiction of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> under this Law, notifying the concerned parties thereof, and announcing and publishing them. 5- Supervising the management of the debtor's assets and business, the swift progress of procedures, and taking the necessary measures as set out in this Law...". And Article (32) stipulates that "The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, upon a request submitted to him by the regulatory authority or any interested party, may decide to take any of the precautionary measures <orig>التدابير التحفظية</orig>, including placing seals on the debtor's place of business, appointing a temporary trustee <orig>أمين مؤقت</orig> to manage his assets, placing restrictions on him in disposing of his assets, or imposing a travel ban on him and any of his board members or managers for a specific period or until a certain event occurs. The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>, upon a request submitted to him by the debtor, may issue his decision to stay claims <orig>وقف المطالبات</orig>." And Article (52/1) stipulates that "The Inspector <orig>المفتش</orig>, in the course of carrying out the task assigned to him, may request to hear the testimony of any person without an oath, and he may also request any information or documents from the debtor, a creditor, units subject to the Central Bank, persons licensed by the Authority, regulatory bodies, or any governmental or non-governmental entity."
Based on the foregoing, and as the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> has requested the issuance of a decision authorizing him to obtain the bank account statements of Ghazal Insurance Company <orig>شركة غزال للتأمين</orig> from Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig>, Gulf Bank <orig>بنك الخليج</orig>, and Boubyan Bank <orig>بنك بوبيان</orig> so that he can complete his scope of work and carry out the necessary financial and criminal investigation procedures and obtain the necessary arrest and prosecution orders. And since granting the Trustee's <orig>الأمين</orig> request serves the interest of the creditors and the bankruptcy estate, we hereby decide to issue the decision authorizing him to obtain the company's bank account statements from the aforementioned banks for the period specified.
Therefore, we have decided the following:
To authorize the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> to obtain the following bank account statements of Ghazal Insurance Company <orig>شركة غزال للتأمين</orig>:
1- Account No. (96237683) with Gulf Bank <orig>بنك الخليج</orig>
2- Account No. (0114334002) with Boubyan Bank <orig>بنك بوبيان</orig>
3- The company's accounts with Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig>.
This is for the period from 1/1/2025 to date. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall provide the Trustee <orig>الأمين</orig> with a certified copy of this decision and notify the concerned parties thereof in accordance with the law.

Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>
Court Clerk <orig>أمين السر</orig>

In accordance with Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, decisions issued by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall be considered writs of execution in accordance with this Law. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall affix the writ of execution <orig>الصيغة التنفيذية</orig> to them, and they shall be enforceable immediately upon issuance and without notification.

# Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>

## Administrative Decision No. (13) of 2025 Regarding the Cancellation of the License for the Electronic Media Outlet Named (Al-Rawdatain Electronic Newspaper)

The Assistant Undersecretary for the Press, Publishing, and Publications Sector <orig>الوكيل المساعد لقطاع الصحافة والنشر والمطبوعات</orig>

Having reviewed,
- Law No. 8 of 2016 regarding the Regulation of Electronic Media.
- Ministerial Decision No. 100 of 2016 issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. 8 of 2016 regarding the Regulation of Electronic Media.
- Administrative Decision No. 655 of 2022 regarding the Delegation of Certain Competencies.
- Electronic Media License No. 189/2017 issued on: 09/11/2017
- The request submitted by the license holder on 15/04/2025.
- The letter from the Director of the Electronic Publishing Department No. 21 dated: 16/04/2025
- And as required by the public interest.

**Has Decided**

### (Article One)
License No. 189 / 2017 for the electronic media outlet named (Al-Rawdatain Electronic Newspaper <orig>جريدة الروضتين الإلكترونية</orig>) is hereby canceled by law, based on the request of the license holder, in accordance with the last paragraph, clause 8 of Article 16 of the aforementioned Law No. 8 of 2016 regarding the Regulation of Electronic Media.

### (Article Two)
- The concerned parties shall be notified of this decision, and it shall be published on the Ministry's website and in the Official Gazette.

Assistant Undersecretary for the Press,
Publishing, and Publications Sector

Issued on: 24 Shawwal 1446 H
Corresponding to: 22 April 2025 AD

---

## Administrative Decision No. (14) of 2025 Regarding the Cancellation of the License for (Al-Makshouf) Magazine

- The Assistant Undersecretary of the Ministry of Information for Press, Publishing, and Publications Affairs <orig>وكيل وزارة الإعلام المساعد لشؤون الصحافة والنشر والمطبوعات</orig>
- Having reviewed Law No. 3 of 2006 regarding Press and Publications, and its amendments.
- Ministerial Decision No. 52 of 2006 regarding the Executive Regulations of the Press and Publications Law and its amendments.
- The letter from the Local Press Department No. 186 dated 15/4/2025, which includes the request of the license holder.

**Has Decided**

### (Article One)
The license issued for (Al-Makshouf <orig>عالمكشوف</orig>) magazine, issued on 24/7/2001, is hereby canceled based on the request of the license holder, in accordance with the last paragraph of Article (14) of the aforementioned Law No. 3 of 2006.

### (Article Two)
The competent authorities shall implement this decision. It shall be published in the Official Gazette, and the concerned parties shall be notified by registered letter with acknowledgment of receipt.

Assistant Undersecretary
for Press, Publishing, and Publications Affairs

Issued on: 24 Shawwal 1446 H
Corresponding to: 22 April 2025 AD.

# Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>
## Ministerial Resolution No. (49) of 2025 Amending Ministerial Resolution No. (24) of 2020 Regarding the Formation of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Unit

The Minister of Commerce and Industry,
Having reviewed:
- Decree-Law No. (15) of 1979 regarding the Civil Service and its amending laws,
- And the Decree issued on April 4, 1979, regarding the Civil Service System, and its amending decrees,
- Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance,
- Decree No. (73) of 2024 on the formation of the Ministry,
- Ministerial Resolution No. (24) of 2020 regarding the formation of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Unit and its amending resolutions,
- Letter from the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> No. (I_023662_2025) dated 06-04-2025, regarding the resignation of the Supreme Committee member of the Insurance Regulatory Unit representing the Ministry of Commerce and Industry,
- Nomination letter from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> No. (MOCI_024328_2024) dated 07-04-2025,
- And based on the requirements of the public interest,

Has decided

### Article One
Article One of the aforementioned Ministerial Resolution No. (24) of 2020 shall be amended with respect to the membership of the representative of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> as follows:
- Mrs. Marwa Badah Muslim Al-Juaidan <orig>مروة بداح مسلم الجعيدان</orig> (representative of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>).

### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall come into force from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

Minister of Commerce and Industry
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajil <orig>خليفة عبدالله العجيل</orig>

Issued on: 19 Shawwal 1446 H
Corresponding to: 17 April 2025 G

# Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>
## Ministerial Resolution No. 561 of 2025 Regarding: Amending Some Provisions of Ministerial Resolution No. 81/1976 on the Executive Regulations of the Traffic Law and its Amendments

The First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior
- Having reviewed Decree-Law No. 67/1976 regarding Traffic and its amendments.
- And Ministerial Resolution No. 81/1976 on the Executive Regulations of the Traffic Law and its amendments.
- And the letter of the Assistant Undersecretary for Traffic and Operations Affairs No. 79129 dated 11/3/2025 and its attachments.
- And based on the proposal of the Undersecretary.

Has decided

### Article (1)
Article (211 bis) of the aforementioned Ministerial Resolution No. 81/1976 shall be amended to read as follows:-
The settlement amount with the accused in the case of exceeding the established maximum speed limit, in implementation of the provision of Clause (7) of Article (41) of Decree-Law No. 67/1976 amending some provisions of Decree-Law No. 67/1976 regarding Traffic, shall be in accordance with the following principles:-
1- A sum of seventy dinars shall be paid in case of exceeding the established maximum speed limit by no more than twenty kilometers.
2- A sum of eighty dinars shall be paid in case of exceeding the established maximum speed limit by more than twenty kilometers and up to thirty kilometers.
3- A sum of ninety dinars shall be paid in case of exceeding the established maximum speed limit by more than thirty kilometers and up to forty kilometers.
4- A sum of one hundred dinars shall be paid in case of exceeding the established maximum speed limit by more than forty kilometers and up to fifty kilometers.
5- A sum of one hundred and twenty dinars shall be paid in case of exceeding the established maximum speed limit by more than fifty kilometers and up to sixty kilometers.
6- A sum of one hundred and thirty dinars shall be paid in case of exceeding the established maximum speed limit by more than sixty kilometers and up to seventy kilometers.
7- A sum of one hundred and fifty dinars shall be paid in case of exceeding the established maximum speed limit by more than seventy kilometers.

### Article (2)
The Undersecretary shall implement this resolution, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

First Deputy Prime Minister
and Minister of Interior
Fahad Yousuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Issued on: 4 Shawwal 1446 H
Corresponding to: 2 April 2025 G

***

*\*Requirements and Specifications for Licensing a Unit or Complex for Providing Psychological Treatment and Counseling in the Private Medical Sector\**

### First: Definitions
For the purposes of applying the provisions of these regulations, the following words and phrases shall have the meanings assigned to each:
1- Psychological Treatment and Counseling: The provision of non-pharmacological "professional psychological services" to individuals, families, groups, public organizations, or private organizations, whether for a fee or free of charge.
2- Professional Psychological Services: The practical application of scientifically proven psychological principles, methods, or procedures for the purpose of treating or eliminating behavior

The scope of practice for psychotherapy and psychological and social counseling includes all of the following:
- a- Diagnosing and treating psychological problems related to thoughts, feelings, and behavior, as well as the psychological symptoms of physical illness, physical injury, or disability.
- b- Providing non-pharmacological psychotherapy accompanying the treatment of alcohol addiction, dependency disorders, and drug abuse problems.
- c- Administering psychological scales and assessments, intelligence and personality tests, and tests of cognitive abilities, interests, attitudes, and professional and academic aptitudes.
- d- Education and awareness related to topics of psychological assessment, therapy, counseling, and the management and improvement of academic and work environments.
- e- Providing psychological guidance, psychotherapy, psychoanalysis, cognitive-behavioral therapy, hypnotherapy, breathwork and mindfulness therapy, dialectical behavior therapy, marital and family counseling, applied behavior analysis, or any non-pharmacological therapeutic practices that fall under therapy or psychological counseling.
- f- Measuring neurocognitive abilities, developing and implementing clinical neuropsychological treatment and rehabilitation programs, measurement using biofeedback or neurofeedback devices, and the use of electroencephalography (EEG) devices.
- 3- Psychological Counseling Unit: A place where psychological counseling is provided by a licensed Kuwaiti psychotherapist who works alone without other professionals, within an independent, contiguous space.
- 4- Psychological Counseling Complex: A place where psychological counseling is provided by one or more psychotherapists in addition to one or more of the professionals stipulated in the workforce clause, provided that the complex is within an independent, contiguous space or on consecutive floors.

## Second: Conditions for Granting a License to Open a Psychological Counseling Unit or Complex:
1- A license to open a psychological counseling unit shall be granted to a licensed Kuwaiti psychotherapist with at least the grade of Senior Psychotherapist Practitioner (in accordance with the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>), and who holds a doctorate degree according to the requirements stipulated in this decision, provided that they work in the unit alone without other psychotherapists or professionals.
2- A license to open a psychological counseling complex shall be granted to one or more licensed Kuwaiti psychotherapists with at least the grade of Senior Psychotherapist Practitioner (in accordance with the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>), and who holds a doctorate degree according to the requirements stipulated in this decision, provided that they are fully dedicated to working in the psychological counseling complex. Full dedication means holding a valid license from the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> to practice the profession in the private medical sector at the health facility where they work, and no other. In addition to the license holder, one or more of the professionals stipulated in the workforce clause of this decision shall work in this complex.
3- A license to open a psychological counseling complex shall be granted to a Kuwaiti medical company whose purposes include establishing, operating, and managing a facility for providing psychological counseling, provided that a licensed psychotherapist with at least the grade of Senior Psychotherapist Practitioner (in accordance with the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>) works therein, holds a doctorate degree according to the requirements stipulated in this decision, and is fully dedicated to working in the psychological counseling complex, in addition to one or more of the professionals stipulated in the workforce clause of this decision.

## Third: Specifications for a Psychological Counseling Unit or Complex
The unit or complex must meet the following general standards and conditions:
1- The location must be suitable and easily accessible to clients.
2- There must be rooms prepared for meeting with cases, with an area of no less than 9 square meters, characterized by a calm and private atmosphere.
3- The number of rooms in the facility shall not be less than two, and this number may be increased in line with the type of services to be provided.
4- A suitable place for confidentially storing client files must be provided.
5- An information system appropriate for the workload must be provided for scheduling appointments, handling inquiries, and providing medical record forms.
6- A waiting and reception hall, which should be divided into separate waiting areas for men and women, and separate restrooms for men and women.
7- An alarm bell to call for assistance must be provided in each consultation room.
8- An insurance policy must be obtained from a licensed company approved by the competent authorities in the state against risks arising from the buildings, devices, machinery, and medical equipment, which shall cover patients, accompanying persons, employees, and visitors.
9- Surveillance cameras must be provided in waiting areas and hallways.

## Fourth: Workforce in the Psychological Complex:
It is required to have at least one psychotherapist who holds a doctorate degree according to the requirements stipulated in this decision, who is fully dedicated to working in the psychological complex and supervises those under them in responsibility for the technical services provided. Additionally, one or more professionals from the following specializations must also work in the complex:

must hold at least a Master's degree or a Higher Diploma and have practical experience and clinical training in accordance with the requirements stipulated in this decision, and with at least the grade of Senior Psychotherapist (in accordance with the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>).

2- Psychological Researcher: A specialist in psychology who conducts clinical or counseling interviews, and whose work is limited to collecting information and administering appropriate psychological assessments for cases as requested and under the supervision of a licensed psychotherapist. Must hold a Bachelor's degree in psychology according to the requirements stipulated in this decision, and with at least the grade of Psychological Researcher (in accordance with the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>), provided that they do not provide any clinical psychotherapy services.

3- Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) Specialist: A specialist in understanding, analyzing, and identifying the causes of disordered behavior, who develops and implements an educational program to modify behavior, especially for individuals with disabilities, by applying applied learning techniques. Must hold a Bachelor's degree in psychology and a professional certificate in applied behavior analysis accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig>, with a grade equivalent to at least a Psychotherapist Practitioner (in accordance with the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>), provided that they do not provide any clinical psychotherapy services.

4- Applied Behavioral Technician: A specialist in implementing an educational program to modify behavior, especially for individuals with disabilities, by applying applied learning techniques. Must hold a diploma in applied behavior analysis accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig>, with a grade equivalent to at least a Therapy Technician (in accordance with the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>), provided that they do not provide any clinical psychotherapy services.

5- Occupational Therapist: A specialist in rehabilitation for cases suffering from difficulties in performing daily life or work tasks. Provides therapeutic interventions to enable children with disabilities to participate effectively in school and social life, helps patients recover from injuries to regain their skills, and provides support for the elderly who suffer from impairments in their physical or cognitive abilities. Must hold at least a Bachelor's degree in the field of occupational therapy, with at least the grade of Occupational Therapy Practitioner (in accordance with the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>), provided that they do not provide any clinical psychotherapy services.

6- Speech and Hearing Specialist: A specialist in providing therapy for individuals suffering from disorders in the areas of hearing, communication, and spoken and written language. Must hold at least a Bachelor's degree in the field of speech and hearing therapy, with at least the grade of Speech and Hearing Practitioner (in accordance with the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>), provided that they do not provide any clinical psychotherapy services.

7- Any other health specializations related to psychotherapy, after obtaining the approval of the Psychiatry Department at the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.

8- Director of the Psychological Complex: In the event the license holder of the psychological complex does not wish to be its medical director, they must appoint a medical director who will be technically responsible for it and will actually supervise the management of its operations, in accordance with the following controls:
- a- Must be a psychotherapist with at least the grade of Senior Psychotherapist and hold a doctorate degree according to the requirements stipulated in this decision, and must be fully dedicated to working at the psychological complex.
- b- Must not have been previously convicted by a court of a crime against honor or integrity.
- c- Their period of residence in the country must not be less than 9 months each year.
- d- Must not be a medical director of any other health facility or any of its branches.
- e- Must have experience in the field of management or the complex's activities.
- f- Must obtain prior approval from the Ministry.
- g- A deputy director may be appointed to assist them in their duties. In the absence of the medical director, a deputy must be assigned, to whom the same conditions apply.

### Fifth: Requirements for Obtaining a Psychotherapist License:
#### General Conditions:
An applicant seeking to obtain a license as a psychotherapist to work in the private sector in the State of Kuwait must meet the following:
1- Hold at least a Master's degree or a Higher Diploma in psychology or its equivalent, having completed the academic requirements from educational institutions accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait, while providing proof of application for equivalency of the academic degree from the accredited authorities in the state, and in accordance with the requirements stipulated in this decision.
2- Have "practical experience" in a health facility, psychotherapy facility, or psychological counseling facility, and "supervised clinical training."

#### Academic Requirements for a Psychotherapist with a Doctorate
Obtain a doctorate or its equivalent in the field of psychology, clinical psychology, psychotherapy, psychological counseling, child life care, a clinical social work program, or a general doctorate program in psychology, provided that the academic record meets the following:
1- The study program must be an integrated and organized sequence of study within a college or university accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait,

or a general doctoral program in the field of psychology or educational psychology (Doctor of Psychology or PhD in Psychology), or any closely related doctoral program in psychotherapy or psychological counseling, such as a program in clinical social work, childhood studies, or child life, provided that all the aforementioned programs meet the requirements set forth in this clause.
4- The doctoral study system must be based on a system of courses and credit hours, including examinations and assessments, as shown in the academic transcript. The study must be actual study within the educational institution through direct instruction with faculty members and with multiple students in the program, and with a physical presence in the country of study for a period of no less than 75% of the study duration. These courses must include specialized studies in the field of psychology.
5- The applicant must have passed at least 17 different academic courses in the field of psychological diagnosis and therapy during their bachelor's, master's, and doctoral programs, as detailed in the guiding appendix of approved courses in the field of psychological diagnosis and therapy attached to this decision. A course may be repeated (i.e., have the same content) provided it is at a different academic level. Courses that cover other areas of psychology not related to psychological diagnosis and therapy shall not be considered.
6- Any academic courses in the field of psychotherapy passed through an affiliation system (without being registered in an academic program) may be counted towards fulfilling the requirement of studying academic courses in the field of psychotherapy, provided that the educational institution is recognized by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait.

## Academic Requirements for a Psychotherapist with a Master's Degree or Higher Diploma
The applicant must hold a master's degree, a higher diploma, or their equivalent in any of the fields of psychology, educational psychology, child life care, or social work, provided that the academic qualification meets the following:
1- The study program must be an integrated and structured sequence of study within a college or university accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait.
2- The study system must be based on a system of courses and credit hours, including examinations and assessments, as shown in the academic transcript. The study must be actual study within the educational institution through direct instruction with faculty members and with multiple students in the program, and with a physical presence in the country of study for a period of no less than 75% of the study duration. These courses must include specialized studies in the field of psychology.
3- The applicant must have passed at least 15 different academic courses in the field of psychological diagnosis and therapy during their bachelor's and master's programs, as detailed in the guiding appendix of approved courses in the field of psychological diagnosis and therapy attached to this decision. A course may be repeated (i.e., have the same content) provided it is at a different academic level. Courses that cover other areas of psychology not related to psychological diagnosis and therapy shall not be considered.
4- Any academic courses in the field of psychotherapy passed through an affiliation system (without being registered in an academic program) may be counted towards fulfilling the requirement of studying academic courses in the field of psychology, provided that the educational institution is recognized by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait.

## Practical Experience and Clinical Training for Psychotherapists with a Doctorate, Master's Degree, or Higher Diploma
The psychotherapist must have "practical experience" and "supervised clinical training" as follows:
1- Have practical experience of no less than 6 years after the university qualification (bachelor's degree), which is equivalent to at least the title of Senior Psychotherapy Practitioner <orig>ممارس أول علاج نفسي</orig> according to the academic qualifications and years of experience stipulated in the decisions of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>. This period may be continuous or intermittent, provided it is in the field of psychotherapy, whether inside or outside the State of Kuwait. Years of practical training or internship during postgraduate studies are counted as part of the practical experience years.
2- The experience must include "supervised clinical training" for no less than 1,000 therapy sessions (session duration of 45-60 minutes), which must be face-to-face with cases and under the follow-up of a supervisor who holds a doctorate and a license in psychotherapy. At least 25% of these therapy sessions must be under the direct supervision of the supervisor. Supervised clinical field training hours during postgraduate studies are counted among the therapy sessions, provided that the number of hours is specified in the academic transcript and mentioned in the course description.
3- The "supervised clinical training" must take place in a licensed health facility for psychiatry or psychological counseling, or in an entity concerned with education and training in psychotherapy. All reports and case data proving these therapy sessions must be submitted while maintaining the confidentiality of this data. The reports must include the supervisor's comments, guidance, evaluation, and approval.
4- The supervisor may be a psychiatrist, provided they have experience in psychotherapy and hold at least the rank of Senior Specialist <orig>اختصاصي أول</orig>, and work at a university, an institute for medical specializations, or a governmental higher academic institution, provided that

5- Faculty members holding a Doctorate degree in a field of Psychology or Educational Psychology who work at a public university, or any higher academic institution accredited by the National Bureau for Academic Accreditation of the State of Kuwait <orig>الجهاز الوطني للاعتماد الأكاديمي لدولة الكويت</orig>, are exempted from the requirement of completing practical experience in the field of psychotherapy or the requirement of fulfilling the number of academic courses passed during their studies, provided that they have practical experience in the field of teaching of no less than (5) years or in scientific research in one of the courses approved in the guiding appendix of approved courses in the field of psychotherapy. They must also fulfill the requirements for therapy sessions mentioned in this clause under "Supervised Clinical Experience".

## Academic Requirements for a Psychological Researcher with a Bachelor's Degree
Obtaining a Bachelor's degree in any of the fields of Psychology, Educational Psychology, or Child Life Care, provided that the study plan meets the following:
1- The study program must be an integrated and organized sequence of study within a college or university accredited by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig> in the State of Kuwait,
2- And the study system must be based on a system of courses and credit hours, including examinations and assessments, and be shown on the academic transcript. The study must be actual study within the educational institution through direct instruction with faculty members and with multiple students in the program, and with physical presence in the country of study for a period of no less than 75% of the study duration. These courses must include specialized studies in the field of psychology.

## Practical Experience and Clinical Training for a Psychological Researcher with a Bachelor's Degree
1- Have practical experience of no less than two years after the university qualification (Bachelor's degree), equivalent to the title of at least a Psychological Researcher or Psychotherapy Practitioner. The period may be continuous or intermittent, provided it is in the field of psychology from within or outside the State of Kuwait.

# Sixth: Job Description:

## Psychological Researcher with a Bachelor's Degree
1- Their work is limited to providing the initial clinical interview or initial counseling interview (Initial assessment), which includes gathering information and administering psychological assessments appropriate to the client's case as requested by and under the supervision of the licensed psychotherapist. When providing services to children, there must be sufficient training to deal with them.

## Psychotherapist with a Master's Degree or Higher Diploma
1- Permitted to receive psychological cases that can be treated as outpatient cases. As for cases that require medical intervention or hospitalization, they must be referred to the appropriate physician or hospital. This also applies to cases suffering from acute symptoms that pose a danger to the patient or others, such as acute symptoms of substance abuse, active suicidal ideation, or cases of severe agitation. The psychotherapist must emphasize to the patient or their relatives the necessity of visiting the hospital to receive treatment, with the need to maintain a record documenting these cases.
2- In the case of clinical psychotherapy, the clinical interview (Clinical Interview) must be based on building a professional relationship between the therapist and the client, gathering clinical information, and administering psychological assessments appropriate to the client's case, in order to formulate a diagnosis or differential diagnosis, after which the treatment plan is developed. When providing services to children, there must be sufficient training to deal with them. The diagnosis is made and signed by the psychotherapist and must be in accordance with a scientifically established diagnostic system such as (ICD-11) or (DSM-5TR), while following any new editions.
3- In the case of psychological counseling, the counseling interview must be based on building a professional relationship between the therapist and the client, gathering information, and administering psychological assessments appropriate to the client's case, after which the counseling plan is developed.
4- Accurate documentation of all information and results of tests and psychological assessments conducted in the unit or complex is required, along with the necessity of writing a comprehensive initial assessment for each client to be kept in their file. In the event of needing to record a therapy session to document it as part of the therapist's training hours or for educational purposes, written consent must be obtained from the patient.
5- It is strictly forbidden for employees in the psychotherapy unit or complex to direct clients to use any medicinal treatments, supplements, or dietary regimens. If the situation requires it, they shall be referred to a specialized and licensed practitioner by the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> in the State of Kuwait to provide these medications, dietary supplements, health products, special foods, or similar preparations.
6- It is forbidden to practice any non-invasive (Non-invasive) therapeutic intervention, such as electrical, magnetic, or ultrasonic brain stimulation devices, or any other similar devices, unless a permit for its use in the unit or complex is obtained from the competent department.
7- The scope of practice for psychotherapists is limited to working under the supervision of a psychotherapist holding a Doctorate degree.

## Psychotherapist with a Doctorate Degree
Performs all the duties of a psychotherapist with a Master's degree or Higher Diploma, in addition to:
1- Supervising the therapists working in the facility, if any.
2- Providing supervision services for the therapy sessions required for psychotherapists to fulfill the requirements of supervised clinical experience.
3- Approving psychological reports and tests, writing and approving session summaries, provided that the reports are free of recommendations. Upon the request of the client or their legal representative, the summary must be free of any recommendations with legal or Sharia <orig>شرعي</orig> implications. If any recommendations are requested by the client or their legal representative, they must be referred to the Kuwait Center for Mental Health <orig>مركز الكويت للصحة النفسية</orig>, affiliated with the Ministry, to write these recommendations.

1- Psychotherapy offices and psychological counseling or psychosocial counseling companies with active licenses from the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig> are granted a period of one year, starting from the date of issuance of this decision, to

Whoever does so shall be subject to legal accountability under the law.
3- The practitioner must adhere to the ethics and morals of the profession as stipulated in Law No. 70 of 2020, Chapter Three, Article (9).
4- The decisions regulating the technical requirements that must be met in health facilities and by practitioners shall apply to the health facility and its practitioners.

Guideline Appendix for Courses in the Field of Psychotherapy:
Specialized courses or academic subjects in the field of psychotherapy. A course is defined as an academic subject studied under the semester system (courses). The semester system is defined as an academic term of approximately 4 months during the spring or fall semester, and approximately two months during the summer semester, or their equivalent in an annual system. It must include examinations and assessments and be recorded on an academic transcript. The study must be actual, taking place within the educational institution through direct instruction with faculty members and in the presence of multiple students in the program. The content of the courses must include the following topics:

## Core Courses in Therapy
- Psychiatry
- Clinical Psychology
- Psychotherapy
- Psychopharmacology
- Ethical and Professional Issues in Clinical Practice
- Evidence-based Interventions.
- Theories in Clinical Psychology
- Group Psychotherapy
- Addiction psychotherapy
- Techniques of Psychotherapy
- Time-Effective Treatment

## Core Courses in Counseling
- Counseling psychology
- Counseling theories
- Group Counseling
- Career counseling
- Multicultural counseling
- Marriage and Family Counseling
- Addiction counseling
- School psychology or counseling
- Counseling for Children and adolescents
- Psychology of Stress
- Stress and Trauma

## Courses in Psychological Testing and Measurement
- Cognitive assessments
- Personality assessments
- Clinical assessments

## Courses in Psychotherapy Methods
- Psychoanalytic or Psychodynamic Theory
- Psychoanalytic Practice
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy CBT Theories and Practice
- Dialectic Behavior Therapy DBT Theories and Practice
- Mindfulness Therapy

## Courses in the Field of Clinical Psychological Service
- Social Work with Individuals
- Social Work with Families
- Social Work with Groups
- Group work.
- Group work dynamics
- Family Therapy
- Clinical Practice with Couples
- Anti-Oppressive Practice in Families and Communities
- Theories and Practice with specific populations (LGBT, Children, Adults, Older Adults..etc)

## Core Courses in Psychology
- Neuropsychology
- Cognitive Neuroscience
- Biological Psychology
- Physiological Psychology
- Affective Neuroscience
- Psychology of Individuals with Special Needs
- Lifespan Psychopathology
- Health Psychology
- Systems and History of Psychology or Clinical Psychology
- Diversity Issues in Psychology or Clinical Psychology
- Personality Psychology or Clinical Personality Psychology
- Developmental Psychology or Child Clinical Psychology
- Professional Orientation or Clinical Professional Orientation

## Core Courses in Diagnosis
- Psychopathology
- Abnormal Psychology
- Mental disorder diagnosis
- Clinical Interview

## Other Courses
- Any course shows evidence that its content is related to psychotherapy.

# Decision No. (72 / 2025)
## Regarding the Tariff for International Transit Circuits

The Chairman of the Communication and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>:
- Having reviewed Law No. (37) of 2014, establishing the Communication and Information Technology Regulatory Authority and its amendments,
- And Decree No. (1) of 2025, regarding fees and financial costs for the use of public facilities and services,
- And Decree No. (43) of 2025, regarding the termination of Decree No. (144) of 2022, on the formation of the Authority's Board of Directors,

- And the esteemed Council of Ministers Decision No. (377) taken in its meeting No. (12/2025) - (47) held on 26/3/2025, regarding the project to stimulate demand for transit circuits,
- And the Decision of the Minister of State for Communications Affairs No. (18) of 2025 issued on 18/3/2025,

- And the Decision of the Chairman of the Authority's Board of Directors No. (67/2022) on 19/4/2022,
- And the Decision of the Chairman of the Authority's Board of Directors No. (58/2023) on 22/2/2023,
- And based on the requirements of the public interest.

**Has Decided**

### Article One
The monthly tariff for transit circuits in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> shall be as follows:

### Article Four
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its issuance. Anything that contradicts or conflicts with the provisions of this decision is hereby repealed.

**Has Decided**

### Article One
Definitions
The Authority: The Communication and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>.
Internet and Communications Gateway of the Communication and Information Technology Regulatory Authority: The communication and information technology systems belonging to the Communication and Information Technology Regulatory Authority that enable it to connect local and international telecommunications and internet networks, to include internet network systems and wireless communication networks with the aim of regulating and supervising the telecommunications sector.
Telecommunications and Internet Company Networks: The internet communication systems used locally in the networks of licensed telecommunications and internet companies, who are local telecommunications and internet service providers licensed to manage, establish, or operate a telecommunications network or internet service to provide communication services to the public. ## Summary of the Articles of Association
### Federation of Specialized Environmental Institutions and Companies <orig>اتحاد المؤسسات والشركات البيئية المختصة</orig>

The Constituent General Assembly convened on 5/2/2025, and the founders agreed to establish the Federation of Specialized Environmental Institutions and Companies <orig>اتحاد المؤسسات والشركات البيئية المختصة</orig>. Its Articles of Association provide for the following:
- Holders of licenses to practice environmental consulting, environmental services, or environmental activities who meet the conditions specified in Article 5 of these Articles and wish to join the Federation shall be accepted as members by a decision of the Board of Directors.
- The fiscal year of the Federation shall begin at the start of January and end at the end of December of each year.
- The ordinary General Assembly of the Federation shall convene during the first quarter following the end of the preceding year.
- The Federation's Board of Directors shall consist of (5) members elected by the General Assembly through a secret ballot for a term of (4) years.
- The members of the Board of Directors shall, in their first meeting, elect from among themselves an executive committee consisting of a Chairman, a Vice-Chairman, a Secretary, a Treasurer, and a member.
- The bylaws have defined the competencies of the ordinary and extraordinary General Assembly, the competencies of the Board of Directors, and the records to be kept by the Federation.

- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (123/2021) issuing the Regulation for the Practice of the Profession for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms, and its amendments.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (363/2009) concerning the organization of the executive body of the Municipality and its branches in the governorates.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (206/2009) concerning the regulation of construction works and its attached schedules, dated 30/4/2009, and its amendments.
- And upon Administrative Decision No. (A781/2024) dated 27/5/2024 concerning the reconstitution of the Committee for Regulating the Practice of the Profession for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms.
- And upon Administrative Decision No. (43/2023) dated 26/3/2023 concerning the registration of the engineering office.
- And upon the letter from the Committee for the Practice of the Profession for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms No. (00007-2025) dated 27/3/2025.
- And upon the recommendations of the Committee in its meeting No. (4/2025) held on 19/3/2025 concerning the renewal of an engineering office registration + renewal of an engineer's registration + transfer of registration.

**Decided**

**Article One:**
To approve the recommendation of the Committee in its meeting No. (4/2025) held on 19/3/2025 to renew the registration of the office / Plan for Engineering Consultancy <orig>بلان للاستشارات الهندسية</orig>
- owned by Engineer / Mousa Mohsen Abdullah Al-Shammari <orig>موسى محسن عبد الله الشمري</orig> [Specialization – Civil], located in: Al-Farwaniya Governorate <orig>محافظة الفروانية</orig> – Al-Raq'i area <orig>منطقة الرقعي</orig> – Plot No. (2) <orig>قطعة رقم (2)</orig> – Parcel No. (4) <orig>قسيمة رقم (4)</orig> – Second Floor – Office No. ((5)) – provided that the license for the engineering office expires four years from the date of issuance of this decision – subject to the fulfillment of all conditions of the Regulation for the Practice of the Profession for Engineering Offices and Consulting Firms issued by Ministerial Resolution No. (123/2021).

**Article Two:**

# Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>
## Announcement
The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No. MOH/S/7/2025/2026 for outfitting 28 vehicles with decals and warning lights – First Responder Project, in accordance with the general and special conditions detailed in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website (www.moh.gov.kw), for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.), only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
It is necessary to attach a letter from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> when submitting the booklet, confirming compliance with the National Labor Support Law No. 19 of 2000 and the Council of Ministers' Resolution No. 1104/Fifth of 2008 regarding the support and encouragement of national labor.
The closing date for the practice is at 1:00 PM on Monday, 12/05/2025, at the bid box in the main building of the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبخات</orig> – Ministry of Health building – First Floor – Procurement Department – Practices Section). Bids shall remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date. The initial guarantee is (2%), only two percent, of the bid value, valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity.

Note: Priority will be given to small and medium-sized enterprises affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development.

4. Submission of a valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage.
5. A letter of authorization and a copy of the Civil ID of the company's representative for purchasing the auction document.
6. This auction is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7. The bidder must submit a letter with an attached copy of the registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
8. The bid must remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving the right to extend or renew this period for the duration(s) it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.
9. Must be registered in the company register at the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> (Amiri Diwan website). https://pnsd.da.gov.kw/ar/form/company-registration/create/

The auction is subject to Circular No. (1) of 2023 regarding auctions in public entities.

For inquiries:
- Email: an.alzaid@da.gov.kw
- Direct line: 22011425 - 22011416

The envelope must be sealed with red wax and marked on the outside with the auction number as indicated above, avoiding any mention of the bidder's name or any identifying marks. The deadline for bid submission is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 22/05/2025.
- The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> will hold a preliminary meeting on Sunday, 04/05/2025, at 11:00 AM at the office of the Director of the General Services Department in Shuwaikh Industrial Area, Plot 1, Street 14, General Services Department of the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>, to answer inquiries regarding the auction. Anyone who has purchased the auction documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. All that is recorded in the minutes of the meeting shall be considered an integral part of the auction documents and shall be binding on the bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their responses after approval to all bidders before the bid closing date.
- The aforementioned cash consideration shall be paid via K-Net card.
- Companies wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must adhere to submitting them to the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> at the time and place specified for the preliminary meeting.
- The bid must be submitted in a single sealed envelope containing all documents, filled out, signed, and stamped by the bidder.
- All documents shall be submitted on three (3) non-copyable CDs, with the exception of the bid form and the initial bid bond, which shall be submitted as hard copies.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the prescribed fees for purchasing the documents.

- This announcement is considered an integral part of the auction documents.

# Al Ahli Bank of Kuwait (K.S.C.P.) <orig>بنك الأهلي الكويتي (ش م ك ع)</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting <orig>محضر اجتماع الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>
Held on Wednesday, 16/04/2025
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> of the shareholders of Al Ahli Bank of Kuwait (K.S.C.P.) <orig>بنك الأهلي الكويتي (ش.م.ك.ع.)</orig> held its annual meeting at eleven o'clock in the morning on Wednesday, 16/04/2025, on the fifteenth floor of the Bank's head office. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Talal Mohammed Reda Yousef Behbehani <orig>طلال محمد رضا يوسف بهبهاني</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> – and was attended by:

### First:
A) In-person attendance: Shareholders representing – in person and by proxy – 1,608,060,776 shares, constituting 64.92% (in-person attendance percentage) of the Bank's total shares after excluding treasury shares <orig>أسهم الخزينة</orig>.
B) Electronic attendance: Shareholders representing 643,774,023 shares, constituting 25.99% (electronic attendance percentage) of the Bank's total shares after excluding treasury shares <orig>أسهم الخزينة</orig>.
Thus, the total number of shares of shareholders attending in person and electronically is: 2,251,834,799 shares, with a total voting percentage of 90.910% of the Bank's total issued and paid-up capital after excluding treasury shares <orig>أسهم الخزينة</orig>.

### Second:
Mrs. Sheikha Adnan Al-Fulaij <orig>شيخة عدنان الفليح</orig> (from the office of Al-Aiban, Al-Osaimi & Partners – a member of Ernst & Young <orig>مكتب العيبان والعصيمي وشركاهم – عضو في ارنست ويونغ</orig>), and Mr. Ali Bader Al-Wazzan <orig>علي بدر الوزان</orig> (from the office of Deloitte & Touche – Al-Wazzan & Co. <orig>مكتب ديلويت وتوش – الوزان وشركاه</orig>), the Bank's two auditors <orig>مراقبا حسابات البنك</orig> for the fiscal year ending 31/12/2024.

### Third:
Mr. Khaled Abdullah Al-Omari <orig>خالد عبد الله العمري</orig>, representative <orig>مندوب</orig> of the Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>.

### Fourth:
Mrs. Manal Jassem Al-Hamad <orig>منال جاسم الحمد</orig> – representative <orig>ممثل</orig> of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
The secretarial duties of the meeting were undertaken by Mr. Fawzi Thunayyan Ali Al-Thunayyan <orig>فوزي ثنيان علي الثنيان</orig> – General Manager of Board of Directors Affairs (Secretary of the Board of Directors) <orig>مدير عام شئون مجلس الإدارة (أمين سر مجلس الإدارة)</orig>.
After Mr. Talal Mohammed Reda Yousef Behbehani <orig>طلال محمد رضا يوسف بهبهاني</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> (Chairman of the Assembly), announced that the legal quorum for convening the Ordinary General Assembly was met, the Chairman opened the meeting, welcoming the esteemed shareholders and thanking them for accepting the invitation to attend.
Thereafter, the Ordinary General Assembly proceeded to discuss the items on its agenda and issued the following resolutions concerning them:
Thereafter, the Extraordinary General Assembly proceeded to discuss the items on its agenda and issued the following resolutions concerning them:

1- Approval of the increase of the Bank's authorized, issued, and fully paid-up capital <orig>رأسمال البنك المصرح والمصدر والمدفوع بالكامل</orig> from the amount of K.D. 249,310,667.500 (two hundred forty-nine million, three hundred ten thousand, six hundred sixty-seven Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 500 fils <orig>فلس</orig>), divided into 2,493,106,675 shares with a value of 100 fils <orig>فلس</orig> per share, to the amount of K.D. 261,776,200.800 (two hundred sixty-one million, seven hundred seventy-six thousand, two hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 800 fils <orig>فلس</orig>), divided into 2,617,762,008 shares. The value of the increase is K.D. 12,465,533.300 (only twelve million, four hundred sixty-five thousand, five hundred thirty-three Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 300 fils <orig>فلس</orig>), representing 5% of the capital, by issuing 124,655,333 new shares to be distributed to the shareholders registered in the Bank's records as free bonus shares <orig>أسهم منحة مجانية</orig> at a rate of 5% (five shares for every one hundred shares), as shown in the following timeline:

# First Education Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>الشركة الأولى للتعليم (ش.م.ك.م)</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting (Amended)
The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of the First Education Company <orig>الشركة الأولى للتعليم</orig> for the fiscal year ending on 30/09/2024 was held in the meeting hall at the headquarters of the First Education Company <orig>الشركة الأولى للتعليم</orig> at one o'clock in the afternoon on Wednesday, 19/03/2025, chaired by Mr. Mohammed Ghaith Al-Tayyar <orig>محمد غيث الطيار</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors – and in the presence of the company's auditor, Mr. Ammar Al-Hassoun <orig>عمار الحسون</orig> from the office of Al-Qatami & Al-Aiban and Partners (Grant Thornton), and the presence of Mr. Ali Mohammed Al-Balqasi <orig>علي محمد البلقاسي</orig>, representative of the Sharia Supervisory Board from Al-Mashora & Al-Raya for Sharia Consulting Company.
After the Chairman of the Assembly announced the completion of the legal quorum with the attendance of shareholders representing 72,412,301 shares out of a total of 85,000,000 shares, i.e., a rate of 85.19%, the Chairman of the meeting opened the session, welcoming the attendees and thanking them for accepting the invitation to attend the meeting. The Extraordinary General Assembly then began discussing the agenda as follows:
1. Approval of the Board of Directors' recommendation to reduce the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from the amount of 8,500,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> to the amount of 3,000,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, a reduction of 5,500,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, which is equivalent to 64.7% of the company's capital, due to a surplus to requirements. The amount is to be returned to the shareholders, each according to their respective share, for shareholders registered in the company's records as of the date of the General Assembly meeting.
The Board of Directors' recommendation to reduce the company's capital by an amount of 5,500,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, equivalent to 64.7% of the company's capital, was approved.
The record date will be determined by the Board of Directors for the shareholders registered in the company's records at a later time after obtaining official approvals.

# Announcement
The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> – Medicines Control <orig>مراقبة الأدوية</orig>) announces the following tenders:

<table_caption>Tender for Medicines - Medical Warehouses Department</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Tender No. | Description | Fees | Closing Date |
|:---:|:---:|:---|:---:|:---|
| 1 | 5SP055 | (Granules) for the treatment of DUCHENNE MUSCULAR DYSTROPHY for the Maternity Hospital <orig>مستشفى الولادة</orig> | 75 | 10 days or more from the date of announcement |
| 2 | 5IN108 | (Injections) for artificial insemination procedures for all hospitals | 75 | 20 days or more from the date of announcement |
| 3 | 5IN107 | Purchase of medicines (injections) medical solutions for all departments in health centers and hospitals | 75 | 30 days or more from the date of announcement |
</table>

Bids shall be placed in the bid box at the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig>, and bids must be valid for a period of (90 days) from the closing date.
Companies wishing to participate in the tender must meet the following conditions:
1- The local company must be registered in the Suppliers Register at the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig>.
2- The local company must be specialized in the medical field, documented by a certified certificate from the Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
3- When submitting two offers, two separate tender booklets must be purchased with two different receipts.
4- Attach a valid product registration certificate from the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Botanical Drugs <orig>إدارة التسجيل ومراقبة الأدوية الطبية والنياتية</orig>, or proof of submission of the certificate, and a copy of the manufacturer's and substance's registration in the Suppliers Register at the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> within the contents of the submitted bid (specific to Medicines Control <orig>مراقبة الأدوية</orig>).
5- Provide samples of new materials, whether it is a new product requested for the first time or from a new manufacturer, for the relevant control department (Medicines – Medical Supplies).
6- Attach a national labor support percentage certificate.
7- Tender documents can be obtained from the Ministry of Health's <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> website.
8- The fees for purchasing the booklet can be paid through the website to be attached with the tender documents.
9- Price quotations must be submitted in a sealed envelope, inclusive of the tender documents, by the closing date specified on the Ministry of Health's <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> website.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability during the same session, based on the price at which the sale had been awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

### Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to issue a lease contract in their favor for a comparable rent."

## Property Description: (According to the attached Description Certificate)
The property of Title Deed No. 11069/2022, located in the Al-Ardiya <orig>العارضية</orig> area – Plot No. 66 – Block No. 3 – Plan M/36875, with an area of 600 m², to be sold by public auction at a base price of 405,000 K.D. (Four hundred and five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** According to the Description Certificate:
- No violations exist.
** According to the Expert's Report:
During the expert session dated 1/7/2023, we proceeded to the disputed property located in the Al-Ardiya <orig>العارضية</orig> area, Block 3, Street 9, House 21, Plot 66, PACI No. 12803986. This was done in the presence and under the guidance of the plaintiff in person and her attorney, and the first defendant in person and in his capacity as an agent for the second through fifth defendants, and in the presence of the appointed expert from the administration, Mr. Tariq Al-Moajil <orig>طارق المعجل</orig>, to appraise the property's value and the value of usufruct for the property from 9/7/2011. The inspection was as follows:
1. The property subject of the lawsuit is located on one street and a back alley, bordered by neighbors on two sides. It has a small setback at the front facade, which is paved, and a portion of it is shaded and used as a car park.
2. The property subject of the lawsuit is a government house, private residence, with old finishing. Its exterior cladding is limestone. It has an area of (600) square meters, pursuant to the Inheritance Title Deed dated 6/11/2022, bearing No. 11069. It is jointly owned by the plaintiff and the first through fifth defendants, as stated in the aforementioned deed.
3- The property subject of the lawsuit consists of a main building, two front annexes, and a rear annex, with the following details:
- The main building consists of a ground floor and a first floor, detailed as follows:
  * The ground floor consists of a living room, a reception hall, a bathroom, a kitchen, and a maid's room with its bathroom.
  * The first floor consists of four rooms, a hall, and two bathrooms.
- The first front annex consists of a room and a bathroom, and the other annex is a storage room.
- The rear annex consists of a ground floor and a first floor, detailed as follows:
  * The ground floor consists of a hall, a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig>, a room, three bathrooms, a maid's room, and a kitchen.
  * The first floor is a room made of Kirby.
The disputed property has an old finishing level, with renewed paint and flooring in the main building only, with the following details: the floors are ceramic, the air conditioning is split-unit, the lighting is spotlights, the decorations are gypsum, and the walls have regular paint.
The expert found that the rear annex is separate from the main building and has a separate entrance from the back alley. The plaintiff enabled us to enter it as she has the keys to the annex, which is completely abandoned.
The first defendant stated that the fifth defendant resides in the property and uses the main building and its front annexes.
The expert found that the disputed property is not leased and generates no income.
The appointed expert from the administration inspected the property, recorded his observations, and reviewed the Inheritance Title Deed for the disputed property in preparation for appraising the property's value and estimating the value of usufruct for the property.

## General Specifications of the Disputed Property:
The disputed property is a private residential villa located in the Saad Al-Abdullah <orig>سعد العبد الله</orig> area, Block 1, Street 112, Plot 199 Blue, House 19. The property is situated on a service street and is bordered by three neighbors on three sides (a dead-end house). It consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, second floor, and rooftop services. The facade is covered with mosaic tiles. There is an elevator connecting all floors, but it currently only operates from the ground floor to the second floor. The air conditioning is central.
The area of the property is 400 square meters, according to the sales contract submitted in the session of 2/1/2023 by the plaintiff's attorney.

## Specific Specifications of the Disputed Property:
- The basement consists of two halls, a driver's room, and two bathrooms.
- The ground floor consists of a diwaniya, a dining room (maqalat), a private bathroom with washbasins, a hall, stairs leading to the basement, and stairs leading to the upper floors. It also includes a kitchen, a bathroom, and a room. There are stairs that lead only to the first floor and external stairs that lead only to the basement.
- The first floor consists of two master bedrooms, a hall, a kitchenette, and two rooms with a shared bathroom.
- The second floor consists of two apartments. The first apartment contains three rooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen, and a hall. The second apartment contains two rooms, two bathrooms, a kitchen, and a hall.
- The rooftop contains the air conditioning unit area, a boiler room, and a small Kirby-style shed (shabra) used as a storeroom.
- The property's finishing is of medium quality. The floors are ceramic, the ceiling is decorated, the air conditioning is central, and there is an elevator.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
**First:** The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. To participate in the auction, a payment of at least one-fifth of that price is required, either by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice.
**Second:** The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
**Third:** If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
**Fourth:** If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session offering to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction shall be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
**Fifth:** If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their liability, based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
**Sixth:** The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
**Seventh:** This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance bearing any liability.
**Eighth:** The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

## Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure states: "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the execution procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request and responsibility of those initiating the sale procedures, without the Clerk's Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to issue a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent."
