## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction begins at the starting price listed for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at his expense during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to him, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the ten percent increase, the bidding is immediately reopened at his expense on the basis of the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The winning bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership.

Property Description: According to the attached Description Certificate.
- The property of Document No. 2021/14210 located in Al-Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig> – Kuwait City <orig>مدينة الكويت</orig> – Block 4, Plot No. 130 of Plan No. M/33695, with an area of 387.5 m2.

* Note:
There are violations, which are some architectural modifications on the ground floor where some shops were merged, the door inside the plot on the ground floor for some shops was closed, and the canopy on the roof was converted into a room, which is a violation of the building rules and regulations of the Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>.

* Inspection:
On 2024/4/15, a visit was made to the disputed property located in the Al-Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig> area (Kuwait City <orig>مدينة الكويت</orig> – Block No. 4 – Ali Al-Salem Street <orig>شارع علي السالم</orig> – Plot No. 4, Automated No. (90011618)) in the presence and under the guidance of the plaintiff's agent, and in the presence and for the inspection of Mr. Appraisal Expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> / Abdulaziz Al-Dughaishem <orig>عبد العزيز الدغيشم</orig> from the Administration. The remaining parties to the case were absent at the time of the inspection, as follows:
The disputed property conforms in its general and specific specifications to Document No. 2021/14210, with an area of 387.5 m2.
The property subject of the lawsuit is a commercial building in an old structural condition, bearing the name (Al-Bassam Commercial Market), located on a main street (Ali Al-Salem Street <orig>شارع علي السالم</orig>). It is bordered by neighbors on one side and overlooks a square and a side alley. It has (2) entrances, (2) staircases, and (1) elevator. Its exterior cladding is marble, and its air conditioning is central.
The disputed property consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a roof. The plaintiff's agent described the components of the property in detail as follows:
1- The basement consists of (15) shops leased to others.
2- The ground floor consists of (15) shops leased to others.
3- The first and second floors are identical, each consisting of (15) shops leased to others + (2) bathrooms.
4- The roof was locked at the time of inspection, and we were unable to inspect it. The plaintiff's agent stated that he has no knowledge of its components.

The Appraisal Expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> inspected the property subject of the lawsuit in preparation for estimating its value (land, building, and total) and its revenue. He also reviewed the case file and its documents and recorded his observations in preparation for submitting his report on the matter.

Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at a base price of 4,720,000 K.D. (Four Million, Seven Hundred and Twenty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of this price is required by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Execution Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction shall be repeated at his own risk in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction award shall be ruled in his favor, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with an increase of one-tenth, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction shall be repeated in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the one-tenth increase, the auction shall be immediately repeated at his own risk based on the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The winning bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request and responsibility of those initiating the sale procedures, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The winning bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property with an inspection that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the winning bidder is obligated to issue a lease contract in his favor for a similar rent."

President of the Court of First Instance <orig>رئيس المحكمة الكلية</orig>

First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
- The property of Document No. 9235/2012, located in the Mangaf <orig>المنقف</orig> area – Plot 12 – Block 52 – from Plan No. M/30161 – with an area of 1050 m².
**Note:**
There are several violations: 1- The shop was moved from the service road side to the square.
2- Partitions were made in the basement and a structure was built on the ground floor as an entrance to the basement, used as a health club with an area of 5 m² A+B.
3- Part of the hallway on the second floor was annexed to the studio.
**Inspection:**
On 9/5/2024, we proceeded to inspect the property subject of the lawsuit, located in the Mangaf <orig>المنقف</orig> area, Block 52, Plot 12, with an area of 1050 m² from Plan No. M/30161, registered under No. 9235/2012 according to the document. This was done under the guidance of the plaintiff's agent, the first defendant's agent, and the second defendant's agent. According to the Kuwait Finder program, it was found that the current address of the disputed property is Mangaf <orig>المنقف</orig> area, Block 1, Street 134, Plot 5212, with an automated number of 93119798. The inspection was conducted in the presence of the representative of Access Kuwait for General Trading and Contracting Company (the property's tenant – not a party to the lawsuit) and Mr. Adel Fahad Maatouq Al-Aslawi <orig>عادل فهد معتوق العسلاوي</orig>, the administration's expert appraiser. The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The disputed property is an investment building (apartment building) consisting of a basement + ground floor + nine (9) recurring floors + a roof. It is clad in beige Jordanian stone, has central air conditioning, two elevators, and two (2) staircases. The exterior openings are aluminum and glass. The building has a front, back, and side access, as it is located on an internal street (No. 134) and a rear square.
- The representative of Access Kuwait for General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة أكسس الكويت للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> indicated the components of the disputed property as follows:
1. The basement is an open space + services, fully leased by the health club.
2. The ground floor consists of two (2) shops on the rear square side. The first is a health institute named Atlas Chain Health Institute, and the second is a car rental shop named Princess, as shown on its advertising signs. There is also an administration office + a glass-enclosed rest area + a guard's room consisting of (a room + bathroom + kitchen) + an apartment consisting of two rooms, a living room, and a bathroom + a side annex covered with Kirby panels belonging to the health club. The rest of the ground floor is closed.
3. The recurring floors from the first to the ninth consist of: each floor has five (5) apartments. Four (4) apartments consist of two (2) rooms + two (2) bathrooms + a living room + a kitchen, and one (1) apartment consists of a bedroom + a living room + a bathroom + a kitchen.
4. The roof floor consists of: an elevator room + a stairwell.
The administration's expert appraiser recorded the observations in preparation for estimating the value of the property (land and building) and the revenue of the property subject of the lawsuit. The first defendant's agent stated that the entire building is utilized and leased by Access Kuwait for General Trading and Contracting Company, and the first defendant receives an amount of KWD 6,000 (only six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) per month for the rents. The representative of Access Kuwait for General Trading and Contracting Company stated that they sublet the property to others for KWD 2,500 (only two thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) per month for the health club, and KWD 1,500 (only one thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) per month for the car rental shop, and the apartment rents range between KWD 170 and KWD 210 per month.

Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at a base price of KWD 1,782,000 (one million, seven hundred and eighty-two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of this price must be paid by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session offering to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges having inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draft a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent."

- The subject of the dispute is a private residence located on an internal street with a separate side yard serving as a garden and has parking spaces. The property area is 580 m², which matches Document No. 2011/3718.

Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their liability on the basis of the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid shall be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction
Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
Property under Document No. (9551/2022) located in Rumaithiya <orig>الرميثية</orig> – Block No. (9), Plot No. (123) of Plan No. (M/28769), with an area of (750 m²).
*Note:
There is a violation, which is an unlicensed external iron staircase.
The property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor, first floor, and a roof, according to the Municipality's letter.
Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin with a base price of KWD 422,820 "Four hundred twenty-two thousand, eight hundred and twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>". Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of this price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. The parties initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges having inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to execute a lease agreement in their favor for a similar rent."

Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding is immediately reopened at their liability based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures, and at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

**Notice:**
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment <orig>حكم رسو المزاد</orig> is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

**President of the Court of First Instance**

# Ministry of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>
## Announcement
Tender No. (MEW / 6 / 2021-2022)
Civil Works for the Construction, Completion, and Maintenance of the Electricity Emergency Center in the Khaitan <orig>خيطان</orig> Area
The Ministry of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> announces the issuance of the above-mentioned tender. Tender documents can be obtained from the Contracts and Tenders Department (Tenders Monitoring Section) at the main building of the Ministry of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy (South Surra) – Sixth Ring Road – First Floor, according to the following details:
* Issue Date: 4 / 5 / 2025.
* Closing Date: 2 / 6 / 2025.
* Document Price: (50) K.D. (Fifty Kuwaiti Dinars only).
* Initial Guarantee: (10,000) K.D. (Ten Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only), valid for (90) days in favor of the Ministry of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy.
* This Tender: Public
* This Tender: Non-divisible.
* Alternative Bids: Alternative bids are not permitted.
* Final Time for Bid Submission: At exactly 1:00 PM on the day specified in the announcement above for bid submission. No bids will be accepted after this time.
* The aforementioned fee is to be paid via K-Net card.
* Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from these fees in accordance with the provisions of Article (39) of Law No. (74) of 2019 regarding amendments to the Public Tenders Law No. (49) of 2016.
* Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the tender must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
* A certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشئون الإجتماعية و العمل</orig> and valid for one year, must be submitted with the bid.
* Bids must be submitted with a certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة و صناعة الكويت</orig> stating the company's registration for the year of the tender.
* Documents shall be placed in sealed envelopes, stamped with red wax, clearly marked with the tender number and subject, and deposited in the bid box of the Contracts and Tenders Department (Tenders Monitoring Section), First Floor, at the main building of the Ministry of Electricity, Water, and Renewable Energy in South Surra – Sixth Ring Road.
* A preliminary meeting for tender participants will be held after (10) working days from the tender issue date, i.e., at 10:00 AM on 25 / 5 / 2025, in the office of the Director of the Electrical Distribution Networks Department.
* For inquiries: Please contact Engineer Marwan Al-Qattan <orig>مروان القطان</orig> / 99922652 at the Contracts and Tenders Department, Fax No.: 25371531.

The National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters <orig>المجلس الوطني للثقافة والفنون والآداب</orig> announces the extension of Practice No. N.C.C.A.L.-1/2025/2026 for the maintenance and operation of air conditioning and refrigeration equipment and devices in the buildings of the National Council for Culture, Arts, and Letters. Specialized companies wishing to participate in this practice may obtain the practice documents for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.), only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>, from the Financial Affairs Department – Contracts Section – Second Floor – Room (1), National Council building, Martyrs Street – Sharq, within (5) working days from the date of this announcement's publication in the official gazette, Kuwait Today <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>.

Announcement

The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> announces the publication of the announcement for Tender No. PAAET/SHA M/91-2024/2025 for agricultural maintenance for the Third Zone – Al-Ardiya <orig>العارضية</orig> at the Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig>, in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the tender documents.
Companies and institutions wishing to participate in this tender must visit the website of the Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> (www.Paaet.edu.Kw) to purchase the tender documents, which are listed under electronic services (general services). Bids shall be submitted at the Authority's main office, located in the Shuwaikh Educational Area – Procurement Department, within one week. The preliminary meeting will be held one week after the publication of this announcement, for a non-refundable fee of (75.000 K.D.).

The Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig>

---

Block 1, Street 201 – Floor (26) – Office No. (2611).
Bids shall be submitted during the Authority's official working hours, starting from Sunday, April 27, 2025, and the last day for submission is Sunday, May 11, 2025. They shall be delivered in sealed envelopes on the specified date before 1:00 PM at the headquarters of the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> – Sharq <orig>شرق</orig> – Block 1, Street 201 – Floor (22) – Room No. (2217).

The bidder must also attach the following documents with the bid:
1- A copy of the Commercial Register.
2- A copy of the certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
3- A copy of the company's registration receipt with the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>.
4- A copy of a valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, valid for one year.
5- A copy of the registration receipt with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
6- A copy of the receipt for the purchase of the tender documents.
7- The bid must be accompanied by a preliminary bid bond for the tender in the amount of (2%) in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by an approved bank in the State of Kuwait in favor of the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>, unconditional and valid for at least (90) days from the last date for bid submission.
8- Attachment of a certificate of payment of contributions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> as stipulated in Article (95) of the Social Security Law.
9- Attachment of a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the private sector. Note that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.

Acting Executive Director of the Operations Sector <orig>المدير التنفيذي لقطاع العمليات بالإنابة</orig>

# Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig>
## Announcement
The Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> announces Tender No. PAS D (2/2025/2026) regarding maintenance and preparation works for the Kuwaiti Club for the Deaf <orig>النادي الكويتي للصم</orig>, by sealed envelopes in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the tender documents, which can be obtained from the Services and Procurement Department – Tenders and Practices Section – Ground Floor, Office No. (5) at the Authority's headquarters in the Al-Riqqa'i <orig>الرقعي</orig> area during official working hours, or through the Public Authority for Sport's <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> website (Pas.gov.kw/tenders).

<table_caption>Tender Details for the Kuwaiti Club for the Deaf Maintenance Project</table_caption>
<table>
| Tender Announcement Date | Closing Date | Document Price | Preliminary Bid Bond |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 20/04/2025 | 08/05/2025 | 75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> | (1,500 K.D.) only one thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee valid for (90) days in favor of the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> from the closing date |
</table>

A preliminary meeting for bidders has been scheduled at the Authority's headquarters (First Floor) at 11:00 AM on Tuesday, April 29, 2025.
Bids must be submitted from 9:00 AM until 2:00 PM on the closing date. Bids must be delivered in red-wax sealed envelopes and placed in the designated tender box at the Authority's headquarters (Ground Floor). No bids received after the specified deadline for the tender closing will be accepted.
- Bidders must adhere to the instructions regarding the submission of bids (CD) on the Public Authority for Sport's <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> website (Pas.gov.kw/tenders).
- Companies/bidders wishing to submit inquiries, clarifications, etc., must do so at the time and place specified above for the preliminary meeting (inquiry session). No inquiries will be considered after this time.
- All documents must be submitted on a (CD) and a non-reproducible hard copy, with the exception of the bid form and the preliminary bond, which must be submitted as hard copies.
Bids shall remain valid for a period of (90) ninety days from the date of bid opening.

# Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig>
## Announcement of Tender P.A.C.I. 1-2025/2026
Regarding the investment of a site for selling and providing food services at the Authority's main headquarters
The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> announces a sealed-bid tender for the investment of a site for selling and providing food services at the Authority's main headquarters, in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the booklet:
1- These documents can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department – Cashier's Section (South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> - Ministries Area - Ground Floor) during official working hours for a fee of KWD 50/- (only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
2- The deadline for submitting bids to the Financial Affairs Department is 12:00 PM on Thursday, 8/5/2025. Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.
3- A preliminary meeting will be held at 12:00 PM on Sunday, 04/05/2025, for companies wishing to bid, at the Authority's main headquarters in South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> / Multipurpose Hall on the ground floor.
4- The initial bid bond amount must not be less than 2% (two percent) of the tender bid value and must be in the form of a certified check or a guarantee issued by one of the approved local banks in the Arabic language, and it must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity.
5- The final performance bond amount is 10% (ten percent) of the total value, and this guarantee must be issued by one of the approved local banks in the Arabic language.

## Announcement
The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> announces that the individuals listed below have had their residential addresses canceled by the Authority (based on a declaration by the property owner or due to the demolition of the building). These individuals must visit the Authority to register their new address (after providing the necessary supporting documents) within thirty days from this date. Otherwise, they will be subject to the penalty stipulated in Article (33) of Law No. 32 of 1982, a fine not exceeding one hundred dinars <orig>مائة دينار</orig>, which is multiplied by the number of persons involved.

Interested parties wishing to purchase must attend the auction site on the specified date, taking into account the following sales conditions:
1. The Auction Committee has the right to sell the goods in a single lot or several lots, depending on the circumstances of the sale.
2. The winning bidder shall bear a brokerage commission of 2% of the sale price.
3. The winning bidder must pay the value of the goods via K-net payment only, according to the discretion of the Auction Committee.
4. The winning bidder must remove the goods from the premises of the Bayt Al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Office urgently and within 5 (five) to 7 (seven) days after the auction is awarded to them. Otherwise, any goods will be seized and sold in the next auction if the winning bidder fails to remove them within the specified period.
5. In the event that the goods are not sold for any reason in the auction, the Committee has the right to offer them for sale in the subsequent auction.
6. The Administration has the right to stop, postpone, or reschedule the sale at a later date if a suitable price is not obtained or for any reasons it deems contrary to its interests.
7. The Auction Committee may cancel or postpone the auction for any reason it deems appropriate.
8. As the goods will be sold in their current condition ("as is"), bidders must inspect them to verify the condition, quality, and type of these goods, which are located at the address mentioned above, during the auction sale.
9. In the event that the winning bidder refuses to pay the sale price or part of it, the General Administration of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig> has the right to resell the goods at their expense. If the price does not reach the amount of the first winning bid, they shall be obligated to pay the difference. In this case, the Administration has the right to bar them from participating in any future auctions.
10. The Administration is not responsible for any handling or use of the sold goods that violates applicable laws and regulations.
11. This sale is conducted in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 10 of 2003 regarding the Unified Customs System and its organizing resolutions.
12. All bidders must adhere to health and preventive requirements.

The Auction Committee

# Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>
## Tender No. (8-2022/2023)
The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the extension of the closing period for Tender No. (8-2022/2023) for the supply, installation, operation, maintenance, management, and training of the Passenger Registration and Early Inquiry System for Border Security at Kuwait International Airport.
Please be advised that the new deadline for submitting bids will be at 1:00 PM on Monday, 30/6/2025, instead of Wednesday, 30/4/2025. Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

Decree No. 34 of 2025
Concerning the Approval of the Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Cyprus
for the Avoidance of Double Taxation and the Prevention of Fiscal Evasion
with Respect to Taxes on Income

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Law No. (4) of 1962 concerning Patents, Designs, and Industrial Models,
- And Law No. (1) of 2024 concerning the approval of the agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Cyprus for the avoidance of double taxation and the prevention of fiscal evasion with respect to taxes on income,
- And based on the submission of the Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following

Article One
The agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Government of the Republic of Cyprus for the Avoidance of Double Taxation and the Prevention of Fiscal Evasion with Respect to Taxes on Income, signed in Kuwait City on January 15, 2024 AD, the text of which is attached to this decree, is hereby approved.

Article Two
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers - each within their respective jurisdictions - shall implement this decree, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Amir of Kuwait
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>
Dr. Mohammad Sabah Al-Salem Al-Sabah <orig>د. محمد صباح السالم الصباح</orig>

Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية</orig>
Dr. Anwar Ali Al-Mudhaf <orig>د. أنور علي المضف</orig>

Issued at Seif Palace on: 21 Shawwal 1446 AH
Corresponding to: April 21, 2025 AD

Based on Article (19) of the Municipality's Decision No. (161/2009) concerning the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in the Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiration or to cancel their classification, and the committee stipulated in the first article of these regulations may issue its decision to that effect after the fulfillment of the following two conditions:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- The lapse of (15) fifteen days from the date of publishing this request in the Official Gazette.
The cancellation of the license or registration shall result in the return of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this decision.
Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone with any claims against the aforementioned contractor for building construction contracts concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial liens in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the construction contract, to contact the Contractors Section at the Engineering Systems Department within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the specified period.

# Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig>
## Company Registration Announcement
The Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> announces the start of receiving applications from companies wishing to register as an approved supplier, in addition to updating the data of companies already listed in its supplier register for the fiscal year 2025/2026.
Note that all procurement operations will be conducted through the Authority's external website.

### Required Activities:
Stationery and office supplies – computers and their accessories – office equipment – electronic and technical devices – publications – advertising and promotion – hospitality and gift presentation – furniture and furnishings – agriculture – translation offices – auditing firms – fire and firefighting equipment – refrigeration spare parts – blacksmithing and carpentry works – transportation and moving services – car rentals – hotels – insurance services – food items and hotel supplies – training services – exhibitions – communication and networks).

### Documents Required for Registration or Update:
- Commercial license from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
- Certificate of the articles of incorporation and license from the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
- Commercial name and number.
- Certificate from the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> (Civil ID Number).
- Phone numbers.
- Address.
- Nature of business activity.
- Bank account number in IBAN format.
- Contact information (email).

### Application Method:
- Payment of the required registration and update fees at the Revenue and Collection Department – Revenue and Treasury Section, in the amount of 20.000 Dinars (twenty dinars).
- Applications are to be submitted at the Authority's main building in the Ministries Area – First Floor – Procurement Department, from 1/5/2025 until 31/12/2025, from 8:00 AM to 1:00 PM.
For review and inquiries, please contact telephone number 25301072
or by email at purchases@pahw.gov.kw
